definition:
Let $V$ be a comodule with a right coaction $t\colon V \to V\otimes A$
of a coalgebra $A$. An element $v \in V$ is **right coinvariant** if
$$t(v) = v\otimes{\mathord{\mathrm{1\!\!\!\:I}}}_A.$$ The set of
coinvariants of $A$ is a sub-comodule with the trivial coaction of $A$.
The sub-comodule of right (or left) coinvariants of $V$ is sometimes
denoted by $V^{\mathrm{co}A}$ (or ${}^{\mathrm{co}A}V$).
